description.value:
Your daring and bombastic ploys have a penchant to amaze onlookers.

Once per turn, when you perform a Gambit you can force one creature that saw it to make a Wisdom (Save) Check versus your Sneak Attack DC. Creatures with an Intelligence score of less than 3 automatically succeed.

On a failed save, the creature is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} by you until the end of its next turn. While a creature is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} in this way, its action can only be used to take the Disengage, Self-Defense, or Hide action. Once you charm a creature with this ability, that creature can’t be @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} by it again until you finish a long rest.

Whenever a creature fails its save against this ability, regardless of whether it can be @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} or not, you gain advantage on the first Presence check directed at it within the next minute.

You also learn the following Gambit: @Compendium[undertaking-homebrew.abilities.MQ87LWRH52O6XSGZ]{Gambit: Avast, Me Hearties!}
